content:
The fourth annual Bucks County Book Festival returns September 24 through 26 to Doylestown with a new cultural partner: the Mercer Museum & Fonthill Castle! 

This three-day celebration, connecting authors and book lovers, features professionally published authors, including New York Times bestsellers Christina Baker Kline and Jason Reynolds, along with Book Fest on the Green on the grounds of the Mercer Museum, and a Writers Workshop. 

Keynote Authors

Christina Baker Kline

Friday September 24 • 7 PM 

In-Person Event

Jason Reynolds

Saturday September 25 • 7 PM 

Online Event

Book Fest on the Green

Saturday, September 25 • 12 – 4 PM

Join up for Bucks Book Fest on the Green for an opportunity to meet 18 authors, mingle with fellow book lovers, and shop the Book Tent, all on the beautiful grounds of the historic Mercer Museum.

Writers Workshop

Sunday September 26 • 1 – 3 PM

Join our popular Writers Workshop, featuring two spectacular instructors. 

​Tsering Wangmo Dhompa is the first Tibetan female poet to be published in English. She teaches memoir and poetry at Villanova University.  

Seeing Images: Imagining the Familiar  • 1 – 2pm

 Alan Drew is the author of the novel, Gardens of Water. He is Associate Professor of English at Villanova University where he directs the creative writing program. 

Character Building: Breathing Life into Your Characters • 2 – 3pm

This is an In-Person Event at Salem Church Doylestown located at 186 East Court Street in Doylestown.

Tickets

Option 1:  Purchase an All-Access Pass providing admission to three Book Festival events at a discounted rate. (Writers Workshop not included in All-Access Passes) There are a limited number of All-Access Passes available for purchase.

Option 2:  Purchase a ticket to each event separately.

Most events will be in-person. Advance tickets are required. 

About the Bucks County Book Festival

The Bucks County Book Festival celebrates literacy, sparks imagination, and inspires people of all ages by connecting authors and readers. 

Their vision is to connect readers and authors, to instill a passion for reading and writing, to benefit our neighbors, and to have fun.

The festivals organizational goals include:

 • To provide a variety of literary-centered events.

• To attract visitors to Bucks County.

• To engage an audience of all ages, ethnicities, and experiences.

• To grow in author and participant attendance by 10% annually.

• To enhance the quality of life in Bucks County.

The Bucks County Book Festival is partnered with Doylestown Business and Community Alliance DBA Discover Doylestown.

For more visit: www.bucksbookfest.org
